title: Happy Thanksgiving, everyone! (+ Elementalist Lux Giveaway?)
body:
About a year ago, last Thanksgiving, I was playing a more active role in the North American Wrenchmen Program with the Arbiters Program in a more secondary role. As the plans to have dedicated Rioters help out in the Help & Support sub-boards started to come to fruition, I began to pivot my focus to the Arbiters Program and the Player Behavior & Moderation sub-boards. 

There are so many people I'd like to thank, but first and foremost, I'd like to thank the other volunteers in our different regional volunteer programs, from NA to OCE to EU. Their work in providing more insight, clarity, and engagement to players has been nothing short of amazing. 

It should be no surprise that my next thanks goes out to Riot and the Rioters who have made this program possible. Working with Player Support specialists, NOC Technicians, Community Coordinators, and Project Specialists has been an absolute honor, and to be completely honest, has given me a lot of the perspective on the Player Behavior systems and Riot Games as a whole that I hold today. (Also, shoutout to my Recruiting Coordinator for giving me an opportunity to speak to her about my passions and experience, and then a further opportunity to speak with the team I'm applying to; hopefully I'll have good news to share at the end of this)

And finally, saving the best of the best for last, my deepest thanks to the League of Legends community. You guys have been amazing to work with. The Arbiters Program didn't have a perfect launch and the implications of the program weren't yet clear, but somehow things came together. Thank you for being patient with us, and thank you for your help in the Player Behavior & Moderation sub-boards. We're at a point where community members are able to step in and provide insight into the punishment escalation system, Leaverbuster, and the other PB systems. But most importantly, thank you for keeping us honest. There are times where I find myself speaking in defense of certain Riot policies or decisions, and a good number of you will passionately speak in favor or against of what I have to say. I do read your comments, and regardless of whether you agree or disagree, I respect what you have to say and give a lot of thought to it. 
________________________________

As a small token of our appreciation, we'll be giving away 5 mystery skins and Elementalist Lux. How can you snag a gift? Post a comment with something that you're thankful for (League related or not League related, doesn't matter) and a number between 1-1000! 5 of the skins will be given away randomly. Elementalist Lux will likely be given away if someone picks the right number, but I'll have a more definitive answer on the guidelines later.  Winners for the mystery gifts will be selected at random times throughout the giveaway period, so the sooner you post, the better. The giveaway will close this Sunday at 11:59PM PST, when remaining recipients will be determined. Be sure to upvote!

And of course, to celebrate the diversity and inclusiveness of the Boards, all players in good standing from NA, OCE, EUW, and EUNE are eligible for gifts! :D

Happy Turkey Day!

http://img07.deviantart.net/a4f0/i/2011/328/2/6/anivia_turkey_by_evangeelliot-d4h67lk.jpg

Now where da heck is this skin?!?! (heh jk sorry if I offended any Anivia mains)

Im thankful for Riot Games. Riot games created League of Legends. League of Legends helped me meet the guy of my dream and whom ive dated since then. Ive gotten so many friends. League helped me realize my passion of art and cosplay. League opened my eyes and showed me what it really was like to love someone and to be loved. riot improved my life 10 fold. So, Thank you Riot Games. Youve brought so many lifes together and you brought some of us out of the depths of Hell when we were falling it.

And! My number is 639.

Also, Wuks, whats your favorite champion?

League was something that I was able to bond over in my first relationship, I've made many friends through League, and League has also helped me develop a lot of my passions, so I can completely connect with your experience. I'm glad that you're in a good place and wish you the best! 

Gameplay-wise, I like Teemo because people tend to underestimate him as a champion and subsequently me as a player; it's the same reason I played things like Twitch jungle and Heimerdinger top. Personality-wise, I appreciate Wukong's ambitiousness. When something seems impossible, I'll find a way to get it done.

Thanks for replying! I understand completely and for me personally, I love Lux so much. Shes like my perfect match. Ive cosplayed her andi have mastery 7 on her. I always love being able to get a clutch flash onto the enemies carries and 1 shot 2 or 3 of them at once. I also love that i can play her in multiple roles, Ive played lux everywhere but top. Because i hate top. But i love Lux jungle because of herganking potential with shield and snare. I actually played it earlier and went 18-4 lol.

Youre so sweet and id love to see how good your teemo really is!

I guess I should make a list :)

1. "Thank you!" to my family, friends and everybody who appeared in my life for making me who I am.

2. "Thank you!" to my League friend Jingle Jangle who picked me up at Gold V (where I played 1 game per month to stay on surface for the skin) and inspired me to climb further, to test my own skills.

3. "Thank you!" to Riot Games for creating League of Legends where I grew as a person and a player.

4. "Thank you!" to Sebastien "Chemicalseb" Najand, Alex "Scherzophrenia" Temple, Jason "Protoshredanoid" Willey, Edouard "Ed The Conqueror" Brenneisen and Christian "Praeco" Linke for gifting us with the masterpieces (of Evil) of League music and to everybody who transfered note sheets into chills in our spines and hours of listening.

5. "Thank you!" to Riot Support crew and certain members of it: SmthCool - for valued discussion about "non-meta" strategies, Hueronymous and DaPerfectTen - for warm words about my drawings, and Blitzcrank Bot - for solving my issue with Unchained Alistar within seconds.

6. "Thank you!" to the government of my country for making me unable to buy RP for money encouraging me to enter different contests and win some of them.

7. "Thank you!" to SeekerK for giving me a chance as digital artist and for shiny prizes.

8. "Thank you!" to Sir Terry Pratchett for unique experience through all his books. It was an Honour to live during his lifetime. Rest in peace.

9. "Thank you!" to Lindsey Stirling for encouraging me to start learning to play violin.

10. "Thank you!" to my aunt for gifting me e-book and making me fond of reading.

11. "Thank you!" to my Grandma for delicious cakes and weightful advices.

12. "Thank you!" to Yellowcard band for making me think that violin rocks! They are on their last tour, hope you like [their music](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IUNw3xAbNPc).

13. "Thank you!" to Barbara Sher and her books for the thought that chasing dozens of goals is o'kay.

14. "Thank you!" to Two Steps From Hell company's music for making me brave when I'm one step closer.

15. "Thank you!" to Ludovico Einaudi for the beautiful music I can play on piano.

16. "Thank you!" to League community and all the players.

I wanted to reach number 37 with my list, but the following "thankies" would be poor and insignificant, would look like I'm trying to reach a certain number, not to express my gratitude.

Why number 37? Because:

- 37 × 3 = 111;
- 37 × 6 = 222;
- 37 × 9 = 333;
- 37 × 12 = 444;
- 37 × 15 = 555;
- 37 × 18 = 666;
- 37 × 21 = 777;
- 37 × 24 = 888;
- 37 × 27 = 999.


- 37 × (3 + 7) = 3 × 3 × 3 + 7 × 7 × 7 = 370.


- (3 × 3 + 7 × 7) – 3 × 7 = 37.

- 37 is the 12-th prime number while his mirrored "brother" 73 is the 21-st prime number.

Great reply! It's nice to get a glimpse into your life like that, and it's good to hear all the things that you're thankful for.
Also, love the number theory. :)

Number: 97 

I'm thankful that league exist today. Even if it's sometimes a rather negative than positive experience. With negative experience I mean the hate of the community which isn´t rare. I already have seen death wishes to others and that isn't even that rarely then some might think it is. But I for myself also wasn't always innocent; I sometimes spam pinged others when they annoyed me somehow and also was negative in chat sometimes -> complaints about why they didn't play safe/wait. But I never insulted anyone or said worse things which I am glad for I didn´t do. But I´m sorry that I spam pinged or complained about mistakes. And I will try to be more friendly in the future.

But despite this I also had some great moments with the community which I'm thankful for. For example as I was relatively new to league I played Teemo top together with an Udyr and he was calmly and gave me advices and said that when I died it wasn't that bad. I also had people who celebrated others when they did something great. I'm just thankful for that and want to reminder that we all came to league because it was funny/amazing/.... so don't forget that moment and relax if your mates do mistakes, instead of complaining we should cheer them up and motivate them, it's just that a great community makes an already awesome game much, much better. 

I'm thankful for my cousin who showed me the first time league (even if he never downloaded and played it -> we wanted to play a game together so we searched for something as the result I still play it while he never downloaded/played it even when I told him that league is awesome xD); I'm also thankful for those community members who are friendly and make the game more awesome. Also I'm thankful for Riot for creating league and caring about it and the community. I wish you all a happy thanksgiving and much fun with the game as long as you play it.

The number next to mine (37) is free. You can pick 38. I've checked and it has no owner :) Don't give up! Also free numbers are : 40, 41, 43, 45, 47, 48, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 101 (dalmatians), 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, and funny thing that nobody picked 1000 :)

Don't be afraid to take any number you like. The chances for every number are 1/1000. Sure, some of them looks special like 777 or 1000, but chances are the same. Sure, 843 looks more "random" (this number is not taken as well) and you think you have better chances because "random" numbers usually show up more times because there are two number families: "special" numbers and "non-special" ones, and the last one contains more elements (for ordinary people). But every number still has the same chance to appear.

Once you picked a number, update your message and leave me a comment. It's not hard for me to check numbers for you.
Thanks for all the help, so I shall not put it to waste, I indeed will choose a new number and I hope you win something for your efforts to help me and probably others.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Im thankful for Riot and the Positive League of Legends community. Oh, you're going to look at this post, and you're going to think, "Wow, another one of those people who couldn't think of something legitimate, like the millitary, or something else". But no, this isn't going to be one of those responses.

I've been playing League since the beginning of Season 4. Why did i start playing? Well, one day, my brother had his friends over, and they were playing. Well, I didn't have any idea what was going on, but they were just playing this one champion over and over. {{champion:115}} Ziggs. I wasn't really sure what this was all about, but the idea that he set up minefields to prevent people from getting away, and just threw bombs in general captivated me. One day, I snuck onto his computer, and opened up an account on my own. I played through the tutorial. That was the best game tutorial I have ever played through. I enjoyed playing an archer {{champion:22}} on some sort of snow map. I loved how it was sort of like an RPG, like how you get to control a character, yet it was still sort of a combat game. Soon, I started playing on Summoners Rift. Being honest, I only played champions that were super easy, and I only played jungle. Back when I was level 8 or so, I remember smite used to be unlocked at level 8. I would only play Warwick jungle. It was Warwick, Warwick, Warwick all the time. I never stopped playing Warwick until the end of season 6, last year. Then, during preseason 5, everything changed. The jungle changed, everything looked... Newer. More exciting. My interest in League had never been higher. However, unfortunately, they raised the level for smite! I was only level 9, so I coudln't use smite anymore! This didn't deter me though. I brought my Warwick into the top lane. Then, that season, for Christmas. I was gifted a mystery skin by Riot. It was FIREFANG WARWICK! A skin for the only champion that I ever played! I was so happy. In fact, Im pretty sure Warwick was one of the only champions that I played all the way up until I was level 30. Then, my champion pool started to grow, and I started to play magnificient champions such as Zed, Ashe, Draven, Lee Sin, Amumu, Annie, Riven, Lulu, and others. 

However, during the end of season 5, where my toxicity level was at it's highest, I would frequently get chat restrictions. I would get frustrated sometimes, being limited to only 5 posts. However, after my 3rd (And final chat restriction EVER), I started getting reformed (in my opinion). Now, I believe that I am fully reformed. I am only sorta toxic to my friends, and they are toxic back, so its not really toxicity just friendly banter. And sometimes, when there is a Rengar on the enemy team, and Im a Nasus or something, I always say "Woof Dog>Cat ff20 pls thanks". or something like that. Never really toxic anymore.

So, throughout my league career, I am thankful for many things.
1. I am thankful for the punishment system. It reformed me. Despite what everyone else says, I believe that the Chat restriction system is good.

2. I am thankful for the creators of every champion. But mainly, I am thankful for the creators of Draven, Zed, Annie, Amumu, Leona, Riven, Lulu, Shaco, Ashe, Lee Sin, and Sivir. Champions that I play a lot.

3. I am thankful for the creators of Warwick. I played that champion so much, and without your hard work put into making him, I might not be here on this forum post today. 

4. I am grateful for the Rioter by the name of Firefang Warwick? Sorry if I got your name wrong. You were the one that replied to my ticket on why I was chat restricted 2 years ago! Im sure you don't remember me, but I remember you!

5. I am grateful for the people who make skins and chromas. Don't listen to the people that say your Chromas are bad, or your Skins are bad. They are good. Trust me. I love the skins.

6. I am grateful for the hextech crafting system and their creators. That system is the best.

7. I am grateful for the person who made the Bard wallpaper, Yi wallpaper, Veigar wallpaper, Amumu wallpaper, and Annie Wallpaper. Im sure there are more, but these are all I remember. YOU ARE THE BEST, THE ANNIE WALLPAPER IS GOING TO FOREVER BE MY WALLPAPER!

8. I am grateful for the League of legends community in whole. There will always be people doing positive acts outweighing the negative in this community.

9. I am grateful for Riot games in general, keep up the good work!

10. I am grateful to be alive today, and grateful for everyone I know for making me be able to post this on the forums this very moment.


My number is 336.

And as always, the Amumu icon on the bottom of my every post...
{{champion:32}}
Awesome reply! Thank you for putting in the time to voice all of the things about League you are thankful for, it was a heartwarming read.
